FuncDef:
The fec-list command creates a FEC list.
The undo fec-list command deletes a FEC list.
By default, no FEC list is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a FEC list.
A string of 1 to 31 characters. It cannot contain spaces. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To create a FEC list, run the fec-list command. A FEC list contains a set of FEC node addresses and is used to dynamically establish BFD sessions. The FEC list is used to dynamically establish BFD sessions so that the BFD sessions can monitor LDP LSPs that are mapped to FECs in the FEC list. Compared with establishing the BFD sessions that monitor all LSPs, establishing BFD sessions that monitor specified LSPs helps reduce network costs.
Follow-up Procedure
To add a FEC node to a FEC list, run the fec-node command.
Precautions
Only a single command instance can be configured.
